org.strongback.util

Class Values

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.strongback.util.Values

  • public final class Values
extends Object
    Utility class for working with values.

      • fuzzyCompare

        public static int fuzzyCompare(double first,
                               double second)
        Compares two floating point numbers with the default tolerance.
        Parameters:
        first - the first value
        second - the second value
        Returns:
        0 if both values are within a tolerance of each other; 1 if a is greater than b; -1 if b is greater than a

      • fuzzyCompare

        public static int fuzzyCompare(double a,
                               double b,
                               int bits)
        Compares two floating point numbers with a tolerance dictated by the number of bits precision used for the fractional part of the values.
        Parameters:
        a - the first value
        b - the second value
        bits - the number of bits of precision
        Returns:
        0 if both values are within tolerance of each other; 1 if a is greater than b; -1 if b is greater than a

      • fuzzyCompare

        public static int fuzzyCompare(double a,
                               double b,
                               double tolerance)
        Compares two floating point numbers with a tolerance.
        Parameters:
        a - the first value
        b - the second value
        tolerance - the smallest delta that is still considered equal
        Returns:
        0 if both values are within tolerance of each other; 1 if a is greater than b; -1 if b is greater than a
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the tolerance is negative

      • limit

        public static double limit(double minimum,
                           double num,
                           double maximum)
        Limit values to the band between [minimum,maximum] (inclusive).
        Parameters:
        minimum - the minimum value below which 0.0 is used; must be less than or equal to maximum
        num - the input value; may be any value
        maximum - the maximum allowed value; must be greater than or equal to minimum
        Returns:
        the limited output value
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the minimum value is greater than the maximum value

      • limiter

        public static DoubleToDoubleFunction limiter(double minimum,
                                             double maximum)
        Create a function that limits the input value to to the band between [minimum,maximum] (inclusive).
        Parameters:
        minimum - the minimum value below which 0.0 is used; must be less than or equal to maximum
        maximum - the maximum allowed value; must be greater than or equal to minimum
        Returns:
        the function that limits to the maximum and minimum values; never null
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the minimum value is greater than the maximum value

      • symmetricLimit

        public static double symmetricLimit(double minimum,
                                    double num,
                                    double maximum)
        Limit values to the band between [-maximum,-minimum] and [+minimum,+maximum] (inclusive).
        Parameters:
        minimum - the minimum value below which 0.0 is used; must be positive or equal to zero, but less than or equal to maximum
        num - the input value; may be any value
        maximum - the maximum allowed value; must be positive or equal to zero
        Returns:
        the limited output value
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the minimum and maximum values are invalid

      • symmetricLimiter

        public static DoubleToDoubleFunction symmetricLimiter(double minimum,
                                                      double maximum)
        Create a function that limits the input value to the band between [-maximum,-minimum] and [+minimum,+maximum] (inclusive).
        Parameters:
        minimum - the minimum value below which 0.0 is used; must be less than or equal to maximum
        maximum - the maximum allowed value; must be greater than or equal to minimum
        Returns:
        the function that limits to the maximum and minimum values; never null

      • mapRange

        public static Values.RangeMaker mapRange(double minInputValue,
                                         double maxInputValue)
        Begin to create a function that maps from the specified range of input values. To obtain a mapping function, call the Values.RangeMaker.toRange(double, double) method on the resulting Values.RangeMaker instance.

        This is equivalent to calling mapRange(double, double, double, double) with the input and output range limits. For example: 

         Values.mapRange(-1.0,1.0).toRange(0.0,1.0);
        is equivalent to: 
         Values.mapRange(-1.0,1.0,0.0,1.0);
        Parameters:
        minInputValue - the minimum value of the range of input values to the function
        maxInputValue - the maximum value of the range of input values to the function
        Returns:
        the range maker that should be used to complete the function; never null
        See Also:
        mapRange(double, double, double, double)

      • mapRange

        public static DoubleToDoubleFunction mapRange(double minInputValue,
                                              double maxInputValue,
                                              double minOutputValue,
                                              double maxOutputValue)
        Create a function that maps from the specified range of input values
        Parameters:
        minInputValue - the minimum value of the range of input values to the function
        maxInputValue - the maximum value of the range of input values to the function
        minOutputValue - the minimum value for the output of the function
        maxOutputValue - the maximum value for the output of the function
        Returns:
        the mapping function; never null
        See Also:
        mapRange(double, double)
